seriesJson.title: The march of medicine
seriesJson.description: Drama series highlighting important moments in medicine. Each program also includes a public service announcement related to medicine or hospitals.

node.title: Dr. Joseph Goldberger: A simple kind of medicine
node.description: This program focuses on the story of Dr. Joseph Goldberger.

node.title: Dr. Fred Banting: A man with an idea
node.description: This program focuses on the story of Dr. Fred Banting. It also includes a public service announcement by Frank Sinatra, Jr.

node.title: Joseph Lister: A passion for cleanliness
node.description: This program focuses on the story of Joseph Lister. It also includes a public service announcement by Gardner McKay.

node.title: Dr. Walter Reed: Yellow fever experiment
node.description: This program focuses on the story of Walter Reed. It also includes a public service announcement by entertainer Jimmy Durante.

node.title: Greene Vardiman Black: The father of modern dentistry
node.description: This program focuses on the story of dental pioneer Greene Vardiman Black. It also includes a public service announcement by actor Tab Hunter.

node.title: Wilhelm Roentgen: The magic rays
node.description: This program focuses on the story of Wilhelm Roentgen. It also includes a public service announcement by Robert Q. Lewis.

node.title: Dorothea Lynde Dix: The do-gooder
node.description: This program focuses on the story of Dorothea Lynde Dix. It also includes a public service announcement by actor Dan Dailey.

node.title: Dr. William Morton: The pain killer
node.description: This program focuses on the story of Dr. William Morton. It also includes a public service announcement by actor Robert Young.

subject.name: Morton, W. T. G. (William Thomas Green), 1819-1868

node.title: Louis Pasteur: The soft hearted man
node.description: This program focuses on the story of Louis Pasteur. It also includes a public service announcement by Eve Arden.

node.title: Florence Nightingale: The angel of the Crimea
node.description: This program focuses on the story of Florence Nightingale. It also includes a public service announcement by actor Don Ameche.
